data.title: c1805 Memoirs of C.M. Talleyrand
data.text:
Description

Early Edition, Illustrated, Leather Binding, Rebound

A fascinating and compelling memoir of Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord, former President of the Council of Ministers of France. Born in 1754, Talleyrand-Périgord studied theology and became a prolific clergyman and diplomat in Napoleonic France.

Published by The International Library Society, the Fontainebleau Edition.

Containing twelve illustrated plates. Collated and complete.

Handsomely bound in half morocco with marbled boards

Containing the signature of 'Steven C. Hause, St. Louis' to the verso of the front free-endpaper in each volume. Steven C. Hause is a Professor Emeritus of the Department of History, specialising in French history, at the Washington University in St. Louis.

Condition

Handsomely bound in half morocco with marbled boards. Externally, very smart, with just some general shelf wear to the boards. Amateur repairs to the joints on both volumes. Previous owner's signature to the verso of the front free-endpaper of each volume. Internally, hinges tender, but remaining binding is firm. Pages are bright and clean.

Overall: Very Good

Delivery & payment

We send all of our books via courier which is a fully tracked and insured service. In our experience we find this to be the most reliable and quickest form of delivery. Our primary courier is DHL, but we are able to accommodate special requests if required, including postal delivery for items under 2kg. See More Details
